definition: to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)

sentences.english: The oboist is well known for his improvisation.
sentences.chinese: 這位雙簧管吹奏者以即興演奏而著名。

sentences.english: He invited me to play it with the band.
sentences.chinese: 他邀請我吹奏薩克斯管，和樂隊合作。

sentences.english: The top of the funnel is connected to a tube.
sentences.chinese: 通過杯狀或漏斗狀吹口吹奏的銅管樂器。

sentences.english: When he began to play a tune,we had our first glimpse of the snake.
sentences.chinese: 當他開始吹奏一支曲子時，我們才第一次看到那條蛇。

sentences.english: Then try the 7D again, you may find that you can play it more easily.
sentences.chinese: 然後再試着吹奏7D音符，你會發現已經容易多了。
那鋼琴演奏者兼作薩克斯管吹奏員。

sentences.english: The shakuhachi increases the ability to accomplish multi-tasking.
sentences.chinese: 吹奏尺八，可以增進你處理多重事務的能力。

sentences.english: The weather was unkind to those pipers who played in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 壞天氣對上午那些風笛吹奏者毫不容情。

sentences.english: Now he's got the rhythm he needs his wind instrumentalists.
sentences.chinese: 現在他需要的是吹奏樂。

sentences.english: It is perhaps easier to play some notes on the Chromatic than it is on the 10 hole harmonica.
sentences.chinese: 也許在半音階口琴上更容易去吹奏某些音符。

sentences.english: Yeah, you know, you get people on the harmonica playing blues.
sentences.chinese: 是的，你可以看到有人用口琴吹奏藍調音樂。

sentences.english: The orchestra played three flourishes for him and he was presented with flowers.
sentences.chinese: 樂隊三度吹奏對他表示感謝，還有人向他獻花。

sentences.english: Play together, resulting in a polysyllabic phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 一齊吹奏，因此產生了複音現象。

sentences.english: As the trumpets were blowing the queen approached.
sentences.chinese: 當喇叭吹奏時女王走過來了。

sentences.english: Play a fully functional ocarina, an ancient musical instrument.
sentences.chinese: 吹奏具有完全功能的陶笛，它是一種古老的樂器。

sentences.english: The oboist is well know for his improvisation.
sentences.chinese: 這位雙簧管吹奏者以即興演奏而著名。

definition: to perform on a musical instrument
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
to perform music/to play a tune
